translated: The first three emptinesses are the emptiness of the inner, the emptiness of the outer, and the emptiness of both inner and outer. The emptiness of emptiness is the emptiness of the inherent nature of the self that is to be examined and pacified. The emptiness of the great is the emptiness of the world of the environment. The emptiness of ultimate reality is the emptiness of the ultimate truth. The emptiness of the compounded is the emptiness of the compounded phenomena of the three realms. The emptiness of the uncompounded is the emptiness of the uncompounded phenomena of space and so forth. The emptiness of what is beyond extremes is the emptiness of the phenomena of samsara and nirvana that are beyond the extremes of permanence and annihilation. The emptiness of the beginningless and endless is the emptiness of the phenomena of samsara that are without beginning and end. The emptiness of what is not to be discarded is the emptiness of the phenomena of the afflictions that are not to be discarded. The emptiness of inherent nature is the emptiness of the phenomena of the dharmadhatu that are the nature of phenomena. The emptiness of all phenomena is the emptiness of the phenomena of the three realms. The emptiness of defining characteristics is the emptiness of the phenomena of the three doors of perfect liberation. The emptiness of the nonexistence of things is the emptiness of the phenomena of the three doors of perfect liberation that are not existent things. The emptiness of the inherent nature of nonexistence is the emptiness of the phenomena of the three doors of perfect liberation that are not existent things. The emptiness of the ultimate is the emptiness of the phenomena of the three doors of perfect liberation that are the ultimate truth.
